title: Google Photos-style Media Gallery App with 1000TB Storage

requirements.text: Redesign the app UI to look and feel like Google Photos: full-width responsive photo/video grid gallery, date-grouped sections, a top navigation bar with logo and search, and a bottom or side navigation for Albums, Library, and Explore views.

quotes: google photos ki tarha ek copy app bana do

acceptanceCriteria: The home screen shows a masonry or uniform grid of uploaded photos and videos
Photos and videos are grouped by date (e.g., 'Today', 'June 2025')
Top bar contains app logo/name and a search input
Navigation allows switching between Gallery, Albums, and Library sections

requirements.text: Support photo and video file uploads. When a file is selected, show an upload progress indicator. Display uploaded media as thumbnails in the gallery grid.
acceptanceCriteria: User can upload image files (jpg, png, gif, webp, heic) and video files (mp4, mov, avi, mkv)
A progress bar or spinner appears during upload
Uploaded photos appear as thumbnails in the grid immediately after upload

requirements.text: When a photo or video thumbnail is clicked, open a full-screen lightbox/modal viewer with navigation arrows (previous/next), the file name, date, and size displayed. Videos should be playable inline.
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking a thumbnail opens a full-screen overlay
Images render at full resolution; videos have playback controls
Left/right arrow navigation moves between media items
File metadata (name, date, size) is shown in the viewer

requirements.text: Add a multi-select mode to the gallery. When one or more items are selected, show a contextual action bar with Download, Share (copy shareable link), Copy, and Delete buttons that apply to all selected items.

quotes: ADD DOWNLODE OPTION AND SHEAR AND  COPY , SELECT ,ETC .

acceptanceCriteria: Long-press or checkbox click enters multi-select mode
Selected items show a visible checkmark overlay
A floating action bar appears with Download, Share, Copy, and Delete options
Download triggers a file download for each selected item
Share copies a link/identifier to the clipboard
Delete prompts confirmation before removing selected files

requirements.text: Display a storage usage indicator (used vs. 1000 TB total) in the app, accessible from a settings or profile menu. Style it to match the Google Photos look.
acceptanceCriteria: Storage bar shows used space and total 1000 TB
The indicator is visible in the settings or profile panel
Progress bar color changes as usage increases

requirements.text: Update the backend to store file metadata including file name, size, MIME type, upload timestamp, and a unique ID per user. Ensure the per-user quota is set to 1000 TB (1,000,000,000,000,000 bytes).
acceptanceCriteria: File metadata includes name, size, MIME type, upload timestamp, and unique ID
Per-user storage quota is enforced at 1000 TB
Uploading beyond quota returns an appropriate error

requirements.text: Apply a clean, light Google Photos-inspired visual theme: white backgrounds, rounded cards, subtle shadows, the Roboto or similar sans-serif font, pink/teal accent colors, and smooth hover/transition animations on gallery items.
acceptanceCriteria: Background is white or very light grey
Thumbnails have rounded corners and lift on hover
Accent color is used for selection indicators and action buttons
Typography is clean and modern sans-serif
Transitions on hover and selection are smooth (150–250ms)

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/ (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts) or frontend/src/main.tsx
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui
All Motoko backend logic must remain in a single actor in backend/main.mo
nonGoals: Real-time sync or live collaboration features
Face recognition or AI-based photo categorization
External cloud storage integration (AWS S3, Google Drive, etc.)

required: PhotoVault app logo mark — a minimal camera aperture icon with soft gradient fill in teal and pink tones (photovault-logo.dim_128x128.png)
Default placeholder thumbnail shown when a media file has no preview — a soft grey rectangle with a centered image icon (media-placeholder.dim_400x300.png)
